metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5288 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Web content could access information in the HTTP cache if e10s is disabled. This can reveal some visited URLs and the contents of those pages. This issue affects Firefox 48 and 49. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 49.0.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5288` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
